text.section:
An independent system may be constructed in accordance with this section:
By a member county at its own expense; or
By and at the expense of the owners of property that will be served by the independent system.

A person or member county may construct an independent system only if:
The independent system will serve an area that is not served by a project or a municipal system; and
The sanitary commission approves.

The person or member county that proposes to construct the independent system shall:
Submit to the sanitary commission plans and specifications for construction of the independent system; and
If the sanitary commission approves the plans and specifications, construct the independent system in accordance with the approved plans and specifications.

Each independent system shall be operated:
At the expense of the person or county that constructs it; and
Under the general supervision of the sanitary commission.

The person or county that constructs an independent system shall:
Keep accurate records of:
The construction of the independent system;
The operation of the independent system; and
The cost of building and operating the independent system; and
File copies of the records with the sanitary commission.
